item.title: Report E-2023080134
item.description:
Report E-2023080134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: FAYETTE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During post trip inspection driver noticed material coming from drain tube from top of CT. Inspection revealed shipper personnel failed to properly close vent valve. Open valve allowed 3 cups of material to be released during transportation. Driver closed vent properly preventing material release. Load transported and delivered without additional incident.

item.title: Report E-2023080105
item.description:
Report E-2023080105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Trailer had been dropped in drop lot for delivery on Monday 7/31/23 when facility personnel went to retrieve trailer to be unloaded they noticed the spillage under trailer. Containment was set up and trailer was immediately unloaded to get to leaking container. The container was packed in a salvage drum and all contents were cleaned up using the proper PPE and absorbents then deposed of in the proper manner. The gravel under trailer was excavated and disposed of accordingly the new gravel was put back. The spill did not pose a threat to human life or waterways. The failure of the container was determined to be a crack in the bottom of the plastic drum.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During offloading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5-gallon pails of coating (un1139) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080283
item.description:
Report X-2023080283

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080283 Sequence Event: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was loaded upside down. All four bottles had vented caps allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: bottles placed upright. 2. X-2023080284 Sequence Event: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: package was loaded upside down. all four bottles had vented caps allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: bottles placed upright. 3. X-2023080286 Sequence Event: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: package was loaded upside down and all four bottles had vented caps allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: bottles placed upright down. 4. X-2023080287 Sequence Event: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was loaded upside down and all four bottles had vented cap allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: bottles placed upright

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pail was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection, the vented cap was leaking due to improper handling during processing. Due to the spillage the hazmat injured one employee. DescribePack: Vented cap/improper handling. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking from the bottom. Package was put into a damage tote. DescribePack: There is a puncture on the bottom of the drum causing it to leak when stored upright. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was turned upside down and put into a salvage drum to mitigate the effects of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080273
item.description:
Report X-2023080273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: MIAMISBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was brought to QA from the truck due to leakage. When looked at the box the bottom had a small spot. After opening the box it was very clear that the one bottle had seeped out the top due to the offset of the threads. It was placed separately in the tote than the rest. DescribePack: The cap looked to be loose and the threads offset/ DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was stored correctly in the tote with the bottle sitting up right.

item.title: Report E-2023080091
item.description:
Report E-2023080091

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew gravity transferred the contents into one (1) new 250-gallon tote. The old tote was dried, neutralized, and cut up. The cut up tote was contained in one (1) supersack. All Doverphos 213-impacted absorbents, general waste, and PPE were contained in one (1) additional supersack. Both supersacks and the new tote with product were labeled and staged onsite for R+L personnel to profile and dispose of.
